channel.title: [Delta] Login recognition?
channel.description:
Okay, I'm not sure what exactly this is called but, I'm trying to get it to make it so when a player logs on it says something like
"(Playername) has logged in!"
I know there is probably a tutorial somewhere but I can't find it.. :\

item.title: [Delta] Login recognition?
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:31, topic:401745”]Now you’re trying to add a method name to a string literal.

Stop, please just stop.

yell(playerName + " has logged in.");

That’s all you need.[/quote]
This guy shouldn’t be a coder. This people just makes me mad :s

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Login recognition?
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:28, topic:401745”]No, that’s wrong… Because look at my last post.

[quote author=mista pnut link=topic=498801.msg3648110#msg3648110 date=1309538259]
Well, I got pretty close to it, I’m still missing one thing though… Looks like this;

and error is this;

client.java:8485: cannot find symbol symbol : variable yell location: class client sM(yell + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
[/quote][/quote]

lol!!! just put yell( + playerName + "has logged in!"); in your client.java in the place i gave and don’t start changing stuff with it!!!

Read full topic

This error;

client.java:8485: ')' expected ("yell + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ client.java:8485: not a statement ("yell + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ client.java:8485: ';' expected ("yell + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ client.java:8485: unclosed string literal ("yell + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ 4 errors Press any key to continue . . .
[/quote]

don’t put the ‘(’ in front of yell. i really think he’s stupid.

item.title: [Delta] Login recognition?
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:17, topic:401745”]So, I added this;

sM("yell( + playerName + “has logged in!”);

And I got this error;

client.java:8485: ')' expected sM("yell( + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ client.java:8485: ';' expected sM("yell( + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ client.java:8485: unclosed string literal sM("yell( + playerName + "has logged in!"); ^ 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

What’s wrong?[/quote]
You used the sM method but u need the yell method so it will be this.

yell(playerName + " has logged in"); Don’t put sM infront of it.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Login recognition?
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:13, topic:401745”][quote author=halflive9 link=topic=498801.msg3648006#msg3648006 date=1309532434]

Well, It’s much easier.
In client.java search for: if(starter == 0){
Then below u will see something like:

starter = 1; addItem(#);

In that code add. yell(""+playername+" has logged in for the first time.

You don’t need the empty string before playername

So u mean that it don’t has to be""+playername+"text"; but "+playername+" text;
[/quote]

No like that^[/quote]
oh, okay. Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Login recognition?
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:5, topic:401745”][quote author=mrpyro3 link=topic=498801.msg3647639#msg3647639 date=1309502504]
add this to your initiliaze statement:
switch(playerRights) {
case 3:
yell(“Owner - " +playerName+ " has logged in!”);
}
switch(playerRights) {
case 2:
yell(“Adiministrator - “+playerName+” has logged in!”);
}
switch(playerRights) {
case 1:
yell(“Moderator - “+playerName+” has logged in!”);
}
switch(playerRights) {
case 0:
yell(“Player - “+playerName+” has logged in!”);
}
[/quote]

What the fuck did I just read…[/quote]

I lul’d what has are community came to

Read full topic
